abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. Lessons reinforce the
            importance of strong political commitment regarding
            emergency operations, particularly at the highest level to
            ensure success. Under this operation, the establishment of
            an inter-ministerial committee contributed to expedite
            timely counterpart funding, conducive in turn to a timely
            project implementation, but most importantly, given the
            multi-sector nature of the project, support from the
            Ministry of Planning, a non-line ministry, helped infuse
            neutrality in expediting project decisions. Moreover, the
            project criteria of supporting affected areas, provided a
            receptive community would be willing to participate, and
            contribute in kind to reconstruction works, was a key factor
            to success, providing selectivity in the context of natural
            disasters. However, the nature of emergency projects (and in
            this case, aggravated by its multi-sectoral components),
            posed difficult coordination problems, and, in view of the
            fact that parallel financing is usually outside the control
            of the International Development Association (IDA), such
            projects should be firmed-up and, if possible, brought under
            IDA's management, to prevent coordination and financing delays.
